instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BLK_EN: What is BLK_EN? This is a typo of BKL_EN When you see BLK_EN, assume they meant to type BKL_EN.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: got a 3330 with 10.5v on both sides of the backlight fuse. the screen makes a little difference in lighting when powering on and off but the backlight does not come on. i can see the options menu when i put a light up to it. tried a different test screen and same thing. swapped out <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> and have 3.3v on <SIGNAL>BLK_EN</SIGNAL> and 3.5v on PWM, do you think this could be the gpu?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: What is the option menu ? Did you try to fully boot and log in ? If not then try as that can bring the backlight back.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Do PRAM reset first.
Post resistance to ground and voltages too on both sides of <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>. Also check if diode is not shorted.
What you have on <TRANSISTOR>Q9707</TRANSISTOR>, pins 2 & 5?
Measure all voltages with LCD connected.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Okay yeah a Pram brought it back. strange i have not seen this before. Thanks guys.
